metadata.title: CVE-2024-3096 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In PHP version 8.1.* before 8.1.28, 8.2.* before 8.2.18, 8.3.* before8.3.5, if a password stored with password_hash() starts with a null byte(\x00), testing a blank string as the password via password_verify() willincorrectly return true.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-3096` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.22
libphp7.4-embed - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.22
php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.22
php7.4-bcmath - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.22
php7.4-bz2 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.22

criterions.comment: php7.4 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.4.3-4ubuntu2.22').
